text:
When using telnet to call a JSP page, Tomcat doesn't call the page but delivers the JSP source code to the client. Here is an example session with date.jsp, which is part of the Tomcat distribution: ----------------------------- $ telnet localhost 8080 Trying 127.0.0.1... Connected to localhost.localdomain. Escape character is '^]'. > GET /examples/jsp/dates/date.jsp HTTP/1.0 200 OK Content-Type: text/plain Content-Length: 1043 Last-Modified: Tue, 30 Jan 2001 08:49:32 GMT Servlet-Engine: Tomcat Web Server/3.2.1 (JSP 1.1; Servlet 2.2; Java 1.2.2; Linux 2.2.17-21mdk i386; java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.) <%@ page session="false"%>
  • Day of month: is
  • Year: is
  • Month: is
  • Time: is
  • Date: is
  • Day: is
  • Day Of Year: is
  • Week Of Year: is
  • era: is
  • DST Offset: is
  • Zone Offset: is
------------------ Calling the JSP with Netscape works ok.
creator: wille@loverbek.de
Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
This has been fixed in Tomcat 3.2.2 and Tomcat 3.3.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 367 ***
